description: The Non-Interfering™ Protein Assay is a colorimetric assay for determining protein concentrations in protein loading buffer (Laemmli buffer), high β-mercaptoethanol concentrations, and in lipid and vesicle preparations.
before_start:
Prepare Reagent-II - Prior to use, prepare an appropriate volume of Reagent II by mixing 100 parts of Color Agent A with 1 part of Color Agent B. (e.g. For 10ml of Reagent II, add 0.1ml Color Agent B to 10ml Color Agent A).

 

Reagent II can be stored refrigerated for one month or as long as the optical density of the solution at 475-490nm is less than 0.025 O.D.
guidelines:
INTRODUCTION

The Non-Interfering™ Protein Assay is a highly sensitive colorimetric assay that overcomes interference by common laboratory agents. The assay removes detergents (non-ionic, ionic and zwitterionic), reducing agents (β-mercaptoethanol, DTT), chelating agents (EDTA), amines (Tris), sugars, and is highly tolerant of strong chaotropic buffers.

 

The NI™ Protein Assay is suitable for determining protein concentrations in protein loading buffer (Laemmli buffer)1-4 , high β-mercaptoethanol concentrations (<15%)5-7 and in lipid and vesicle preparations8-9 . The NI™ Protein Assay has a linear response between 0.5-50µg and has a small sample requirement (1-50µl). The kit components are suitable for 500 assays.

 

ITEM(S) SUPPLIED

Description Cat. # 786-005 Cat. # 786-896
UPPA™ I 250ml 250ml
UPPA™ II 250ml 250ml 
Copper Solution (Reagent I) 50ml 50ml
Color Agent A 2 x 250ml 2 x 250ml
Color Agent B 5ml 5ml
BSA Protein Standard [2mg/ml] 5ml - 
Non-Animal Protein Standard [2mg/ml]  -  5ml

 

 

STORAGE CONDITIONS

The kit is shipped at ambient temperature. Upon arrival, store UPPA-I and UPPA-II at room temperature. The remaining kit components should be stored in the dark and refrigerated in its original box. When stored properly, the kit is stable for 1 year.

 

OVERVIEW

The Non-Interfering™ Protein Assay is composed of two simple steps (see figure):

 

1. Universal Protein Precipitating Agent (UPPA™ ) is added to the protein solutions to rapidly precipitate total protein. Protein is immobilized by centrifugation and interfering agents in the supernatant are discarded.

 

2. Protein concentration is assayed by mixing with an alkaline solution containing a known concentration of copper salt; the copper ions bind to the peptide backbone and the assay measures the unbound copper ions. The assay is independent of protein side chains minimizing protein-to-protein variation. The color density is inversely proportional to the amount of protein.

 

TOLERANCE GUIDE

• 2-Mercaptoethanol, 15%

• Ammonium Sulfate, 40%

• Brij® 35, 1%

• CHAPS, 4%

• CHAPSO, 1%

• Digitonin, 0.3%

• DTT, 0.35M

• EDTA, 0.1M

• Glycerol, 30%

• Guanidine Thiocynate, 4M

• Guanidine.HCl, 6M

• HEPES, 0.1M

• Hydrochloric acid, 0.1N

• Imidazole, 0.5M

• Iodoacetamide, 15mM

• N-Octyl Glucosidase, 0.5%

• Phosphate buffer, 0.2M

• Sarcosyl, 1%

• SDS, 2%

• Sodium azide, 0.1M

• Sodium Chloride, 0.5M

• Sodium hydroxide, 2.5mM

• Sucrose, 30%

• TCEP, 15mM

• Thesit, 2%

• Thiourea, 2M

• Tris.HCl , 0.5M

• Triton® X-100, 3%

• Triton® X-114, 3%

• Tween® 20, 2%

• Urea, 8M

• Zwittergent® 3-12, 1.5%

 

PREPARATION BEFORE USE

Prepare Reagent-II - Prior to use, prepare an appropriate volume of Reagent II by mixing 100 parts of Color Agent A with 1 part of Color Agent B. (e.g. For 10ml of Reagent II, add 0.1ml Color Agent B to 10ml Color Agent A).

 

Reagent II can be stored refrigerated for one month or as long as the optical density of the solution at 475-490nm is less than 0.025 O.D.

 

TROUBLESHOOTING

Problem Reason Solution
Interference still occurring. Readings very low and show limited change with increasing concentrations. Interfering agents not fully removed due to carry over at step 8. Ensure all supernatant is removed in step 8. There should be no residual liquid.
  Exceedingly high concentrations of interfering agents in starting samples. If high concentrations of interfering agents are present additional washing after step 8 may be required. Add 0.5ml UPPA I and then 0.1ml UPPA II to the pellet. Gently invert a few times without disturbing the precipitate and repeat steps 7-8.
A Linear Response between 0.5-50µg not visualized. The standard curve is not straight. Poor centrifugation at Step 7. Failure to pellet all the protein. Centrifuge for >5 minutes at >10,000xg.
  Insufficient mixing of Reagent II. Use a 1ml pipette and rapidly shoot the Reagent II directly into the tube. Immediately invert to mix.
Low Protein Concentrations. Protein pellet not fully resuspended  Vortex pellet for 10-30 seconds at step 9.

 

REFERENCES:

1. Ho, T.H. et al (2005) Human Molecular Genetics 14: 1539

2. Ladd, A.N. et al (2001) Mol. Cell. Biol. 21: 1285

3. Loeb, D.M. et al (2002) J. Biol. Chem. 277: 19627

4. Shiels, A. et al (2007) Invest. Ophthalmol. Vis. Sci. 48: 500

5. Gushwa, N.N. et al (2003) Plant Physiology 132: 1925

6. DePinto, W. et al (2006) Mol. Cancer Ther. 5:2644

7. Werner, M.E. et al (2007) J. Biol. Chem. 282: 5560

8. Dennison, S.M. et al (2006). Biophysical Journal 90:1661

9. Reeve, I. et al (2002) PNAS 99: 8608

components.data: Perform assays at room temperature. Use 2ml tubes for assay.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Perform assays at room temperature. Use 2ml tubes for assay.

components.data:
Prepare a set of protein standards using the supplied BSA or Non-Animal Protein Standard as indicated in the table below:

 

Tube # 1 2 3 4 5 6
Protein Standard [2mg/ml] (µl) 0 4 8 12 20 25
Protein (µg) 0 8 16 24 40 50

components.data: Add 1-50µl of the protein samples to be assayed to 2ml tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 1-50µl of the protein samples to be assayed to 2ml tubes.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 3 of A Non-Interfering™ (NI) Protein Assay
source_data.annotation:
NOTE: It is recommended that duplicates are used. The total amount of protein should not exceed 50µg and we recommend various protein dilutions are used to ensure samples are below 50µg.

NOTE: For determination of protein concentrations in buffers free of interfering agents skip steps 4-7.
source_data.thread_text:
NOTE: It is recommended that duplicates are used. The total amount of protein should not exceed 50µg and we recommend various protein dilutions are used to ensure samples are below 50µg.

NOTE: For determination of protein concentrations in buffers free of interfering agents skip steps 4-7.
source_data.body:
NOTE: It is recommended that duplicates are used. The total amount of protein should not exceed 50µg and we recommend various protein dilutions are used to ensure samples are below 50µg.

NOTE: For determination of protein concentrations in buffers free of interfering agents skip steps 4-7.

components.data: Add 0.5ml UPPA™ I to each tube and vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.5ml UPPA™ I to each tube and vortex.

components.data: Add 0.5ml UPPA™ II to the tubes and vortex.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 0.5ml UPPA™ II to the tubes and vortex.

components.data: Centrifuge the tubes at maximum speed (~10,000xg) for 5 minutes to pellet the precipitated protein.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Centrifuge the tubes at maximum speed (~10,000xg) for 5 minutes to pellet the precipitated protein.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 7 of A Non-Interfering™ (NI) Protein Assay
source_data.annotation: For easier identification of the pellet, ensure all the tubes are centrifuged with the cap hinge facing outwards. A small pellet should be visible.
source_data.thread_text: For easier identification of the pellet, ensure all the tubes are centrifuged with the cap hinge facing outwards. A small pellet should be visible.
source_data.body: For easier identification of the pellet, ensure all the tubes are centrifuged with the cap hinge facing outwards. A small pellet should be visible.

components.data: Decant off the supernatant, return the tubes to the centrifuge as before, quickly pulse to spin down residual liquid and remove with a pipette.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Decant off the supernatant, return the tubes to the centrifuge as before, quickly pulse to spin down residual liquid and remove with a pipette.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 8 of A Non-Interfering™ (NI) Protein Assay
source_data.annotation: OPTIONAL: For enhanced washing for problematic samples see the Troubleshooting section.
source_data.thread_text: OPTIONAL: For enhanced washing for problematic samples see the Troubleshooting section.
source_data.body: OPTIONAL: For enhanced washing for problematic samples see the Troubleshooting section.

components.data: Add 100µl Copper Solution (Reagent I) and 400µl deionized water to the tubes and vortex until the protein precipitate pellet dissolves.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Add 100µl Copper Solution (Reagent I) and 400µl deionized water to the tubes and vortex until the protein precipitate pellet dissolves.

components.data: Using 1ml pipette, rapidly shoot 1ml Reagent II directly into each tube containing Reagent I plus DI Water and immediately mix it by inverting the tubes.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Using 1ml pipette, rapidly shoot 1ml Reagent II directly into each tube containing Reagent I plus DI Water and immediately mix it by inverting the tubes.

components.data: Incubate at room temperature for 15-20 minutes and then immediately read absorbances at 480nm against DI water.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Incubate at room temperature for 15-20 minutes and then immediately read absorbances at 480nm against DI water.

components.data: Plot absorbance against protein concentration and determine protein concentrations of unknowns.
components.name: Description

source_data.description: Plot absorbance against protein concentration and determine protein concentrations of unknowns.

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 12 of A Non-Interfering™ (NI) Protein Assay
source_data.annotation: NOTE: Do not subtract blank reading from the sample reading as absorbance will decrease as protein concentration increases.
source_data.thread_text: NOTE: Do not subtract blank reading from the sample reading as absorbance will decrease as protein concentration increases.
source_data.body: NOTE: Do not subtract blank reading from the sample reading as absorbance will decrease as protein concentration increases.
